title: Basic Intros. "I am Justin", "This is the water".
reading_greek: Είμαι ο Ιωάννης. Είμαι η Μαρία. Αυτό είναι το νερό. Αυτό είναι το ψωμί.
reading_english: I am John. I am Maria. This is the water. This is the bread.
audio_script: Welcome to Week 2 of your Greek lesson. Today we focus on basic introductions and identification, using the verbs 'to be' and the demonstrative pronoun 'this'. ... In Greek, the sentence structure is quite straightforward for these simple statements. ... We will practice 'I am' which is 'Είμαι' (Eemai), and 'This is' which is 'Αυτό είναι' (Aftó eeneh). ... Now, listen to the short reading passage focusing on these phrases: ... Είμαι ο Ιωάννης. ... Είμαι η Μαρία. ... Αυτό είναι το νερό. ... Αυτό είναι το ψωμί. ... Now, let’s break down the pronunciation. ... 'I am John': Είμαι ο Ιωάννης. ... Notice that 'ο' (oh) is the masculine definite article 'the', but it often accompanies names when introducing oneself, though it translates simply as 'I am John'. ... 'I am Maria': Είμαι η Μαρία. ... Here, 'η' (ee) is the feminine definite article. ... 'This is the water': Αυτό είναι το νερό. ... 'This is the bread': Αυτό είναι το ψωμί. ... Remember, 'νερό' means water and 'ψωμί' means bread. ... Now, repeat the Greek passage after me: Είμαι ο Ιωάννης. ... Είμαι η Μαρία. ... Αυτό είναι το νερό. ... Αυτό είναι το ψωμί. ... Well done. Practice these phrases daily to build your confidence.
